intro: Lipochaeta hetrophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers arranged in dense, conical clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, with a slightly hairy surface. Lipochaeta hetrophylla is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
